fields.description:
Unable to view attachments from GH "Work" or "Plan" mode

Steps to repro:

1.Create an issue> upload an attachment
2.From GH> select Plan mode 
3.Locate the issue created on step 1> try to open the attachment

Actual:

Error message is displayed “The requested content cannot be loaded. Please try again later.” See screenshot.
fields.summary: Unable to view attachments from GH "Work" or "Plan" mode

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I would like to be able to edit fields directly from the 'detail view' of the 'Plan' or 'Work' screens.

My team doesn't use a numeric system to score tasks, so I have a custom drop-down field with the possible options. This has a lot of downstream usability effects (I'll drop another feature request with some suggestions for that particular bee's nest), but the biggest pain-point we're having right now is that we have to open each issue individually to score it during sprint planning. I see that a few of the fields are editable now, but it would be awesome if we could allow or disallow editing on all of the fields instead of having a few hard-coded.
fields.summary: Inline Editing of Fields in 'Detailed View' Pane

fields.description:
As a scrum master, I want to be able to add info such as alerts, dates, sprint goals, and other project related things on the sprint task board (top nav.) where it is viewable by the scrum team

My team recently transitioned to GH and as a Scrum master, I find that being able to put project related notifications in a bulletin board type feature where everyone can view it will be very helpful. With the current GH version, there is no way of doing this, so I had to became creative. I am using the GH board name field to display some of the important info I need the team to know about. See screenshot. 
Usage for a bulletin board type feature can be endless e.g. any project dates, quick project related info/alert team should know about, even inspirational quotes, just to name a few!

I would really would love to see this feature on GH and I know it will be helpful to many. Thanks and keep up the good work!
fields.summary: As a scrum master, I want to be able to add info such as alerts, dates, sprint goals, and other project related things on the sprint task board (top nav.) where it is viewable by the scrum team

fields.description:
When deleting a board in Greenhopper, the associated filter is not deleted. This can lead to thousands of *abandoned / unused filters* in a Jira installation.

For example:
!image001.JPG|thumbnail!

!image002.JPG|thumbnail!

!image003.JPG|thumbnail!

As a user it would be great to have a ability to prompt an option to choose for deleting a saved filter. To reduce the waste of creating saved filter in future.
fields.summary: Prompt a option for user to delete a saved filter when a board is deleted.
Height calculation is not correct in IE10
Wrong background style for "Create epic / version" buttons in IE8
Remove + from Create Board list item in Tools dropdown
backport AUI label for JIRA View Issue pre-J6, remove GH-label css
Work mode sub-filter JQL autocomplete dropdown alignment
Update Version column to ADG style

fields.description: The logic behind this request is if you are doing work on an issue, then it is active in the current sprint.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the Log Work option to only apply to issues in active sprints.

fields.description: The result is currently trivial but the fact it's missing warrants a higher priority.
fields.summary: AUI badge styles not included in rapid board gadget
Move TabsNavigationTest into ConfigurationTest

fields.description:
*Steps to produce*:
# Create GH board with multiple Epics.
# Add as many issues to these Epics.
# Go to the issue navigator, add the Epic Link column to the issue navigator and sort the issues base on the Epic Link.


*Actual Results*
Issues are randomly sorted whereby there is no an exact pattern to follow (nor the Epic key or link Id from the DB) 


*Expect Results*
Once the used order the issues base on the Epic Link, issues should be sorted base on the Epic Key.
fields.summary: Epic Link on the issue navigator is not sorted base on the Epic key
update "The Future of GH" and "Moving GH 6 FAQ" for GH  6.3
Show Subtask Priority in an Epic

fields.description: Stories that stay open for long periods of time with work being logged to them can skew the accuracy of the version report when it's using Original Time Estimate as it's metric.
fields.summary: Allow Version Report to show velocity based on Remaining time

fields.description:
As a user of the Greenhopper rapid board, I'd like to be able to collapse the parent task from the view to hide all the sub tasks associated with it. Similar to how the classic board used to work I think.

Sometimes we have multiple subtasks that create too much noise on the board.
fields.summary: Collapse SubTasks on Rapid Board

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to see a commmitted scope list compared to completed scope or actual scope in the sprint report.

When I change scope of a previously committed to story the total scope changes from committed scope to 0. It should either stay as the committed scope and the changes should be reflected in the burndown chart or I should be able to see the update in the sprint report.
fields.summary: As a scrum master/ project manager I want to see committed scope and completed scope on my sprint report

fields.description: We would like to have versions be optional and not appear in our plan mode (like it was while in labs). We work in a continuous deployment model and hence have no real need for this functionality (though teams do use it for their own needs) and having it show up on the left pane and worse, on the cards in plan mode is a distraction/annoyance.
fields.summary: Please make new Version functionality optional
Investigate whether ColumnConfigurationTest can be tested in JS or move into faster WebDriver tests
Move EditActiveSprintTest into PlanModeTest in WebDriver
Investigate replacing QuickCreateTest with JS tests and / or moving to quick check in WebDriver

- 1 for having gh

fields.description:
We should at least add a url to open in a popup.

To see not in action - Configure Quick Links in GreenHopper.
fields.summary: Syntax Help link for JQL autocomplete only works on issue nav (From JDOG)

fields.description:
In the Plan view of the RapidBoard, I can currently see Versions in a column. These versions are grouped by Project, so if I have two versions with the same name in two different Jira projects, both are listed.

If my development project is split into several Jira Projects that share a common versioning scheme (i.e. they share the same version _names_), I would like to have an option to fold identically-named versions into a single version on that screen. Hence, I would be able to filter all issues belonging to a single (cross-project) version by clicking on that version name, and I would be able to assign an issue to a version by dropping it onto that version name, without having to look for the right version/project combination (GH already knows to which project my issue belongs).
fields.summary: As a product owner I want to group versions by name (across projects)

fields.description:
I would really like to be able to use any Global Rank field type as the *secondary* sort on my Kanban boards. I can see this happening in one of two ways:

# Allow JQL statements like "ORDER BY priority DESC, Rank ASC", but require the user to specify the name of the rank field (possibly a prepopulated dropdown of the existing sorting fields in the query/filter). The problem with this approach is handling the UX for drag'n'drop reordering, which would be sensitive to the context of the primary sort.
# Create another Rank field type, or allow the current one, to default to a particular value (like 0 or the maximum integer value) instead of auto-incrementing the value each time an issue is created. This would allow the system to treat sorting statements the same - "ORDER BY Rank ASC, priority DESC" - while allowing a "default" ranking to take place until the rank value is set (by dragging and dropping a card higher on the list)
fields.summary: Allow Rank field to be used as a secondary sort parameter

fields.description:
Currently it's 'z' to cycle between normal, projector and no-nav mode. Let's separate it so 'z' toggles projector mode only (as it used to), and Ctrl+Shift+F toggles the "hide nav bar" mode.

Rationale: this is consistent with how Confluence does it, and also Google Docs.
fields.summary: Change "hide nav bar" shortcut

fields.description:
Hi,

when we close a sprint and have created a "new" one without issues in it. then the unresolved issues are not moved in this sprint. the at top of backlog. 
When there is a issue in the new sprint the remaining issues are moved in the next sprint fine.

It will ne nice when this can be the default.

Thanks
fields.summary: Unresolved Issues moved to Backlog when closing sprint. Not in next Sprint when this is empty

See screenshot. 

Not sure if 5.2 is affected.

fields.description:
When a mistype in the Original Estimate field is made and it is corrected(say from 9weeks to 9hours) there is still a spike in the Burndown Chart.

This feature request is open to look into the possibility of having a way to remove the initial Original Estimate value so it does not affect the Burndown Chart.
fields.summary: As a user, I would the ability to correct mistypes in Estimations without a spike in the Burndown Chart

fields.description:
To reproduce:
0. Use chrome ;)
1. Open rapid board (which have enough height to not fit to the window)
2. Zoom-in to 125% (ctrl+mouse scroll)
3. Refresh page (it happens only when page is loaded while the zoom-in is already set to 125%)
4. scroll the board

Now you should be able to see something similar to attached image - the part of board is above the column headers.

This was spotted on JDOG.
fields.summary: Rapid board goes above columns headers in chrome when zoom-in is set to 125%

fields.description:
In certain cases I find that I have a need to view a Greenhopper Kanban board without the applied swimlanes. 

For example: a case where we use Jira to define which tasks is to be queued on the development queue for the comming week, with swimlanes based on what system the task belongs to. On this board the rightmost column is the dev-queue, and prioritizing the tasks by drag'n'drop regardless of a which system it belongs to seems impossimple on this board.

If swimlanes could be toggled on/off with a click of a button one would acheive two different views of the same board.
fields.summary: Toggle Swimlanes On / Off in Greenhopper

fields.description: This was happening on JDOG the day after we first deployed a version of GH with ADG
fields.summary: Users saw header collapsed state by default, but the icon looked like the header was expanded

fields.summary: GH updates for JIRA 6.0 ADG changes (mainly Admin nav?) plus Gadgets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-8469].
  {panel}

When opening a dropdown menu with a large amount of options, the menu doesn't force the page to scroll.

CoS:

# Four reports are affected: Version Report, Sprint Report, Sprint Burndown, Epic Report
# Control uses auto-complete, single select style
# No grouping of select options

(!) Dev Notes (!)
Q: Is the frother case-insensitive?
A: yes

Q: Does it search on spaces or any single char?
A: Spaces no. Any character yes. 

Q: What happens when an invalid string is typed in? Can we do other actions?
A: No Matches message, if you try to submit an invalid value it should revert to the previous selection

Q: What happens when you search on closed/archived sprints/versions?
A: same options show up as we had previously

Q: Can you search as an anonymous user?
A: same options show up as we had previously

Q: Is the input XSS-safe?
A: yes


Q: How long can the input be?
A: no limit, if it doesn't match then we revert to the selection

Q: Are there tests to update?
A: Epic and Version Report qunit tests are updated to reflect the changes
fields.summary: In order to be able to select report options easily, I want a better control to use

fields.description:
If I have, as an example, a board with two projects and one sprint on it, and copy this board, it's not creating a second sprint in the _AO_60DB71_SPRINT_, it's using the same sprint in both boards.

The problem is, if after copy it, I want to split the projects in each board, so now I'll have one sprint for each project, one using the existing sprint and another using the new sprint (the copy).

Expected Behavior: When we "copy" something, we expect this will "copy" the whole board, not use the same data (the original data) from the other.
fields.summary: Create a copy from a board is not creating a copy of the sprint

fields.description: When viewing a Sprint, the Epic name is displayed next to the issue summary on the backlog, however, when the Issue Detailed View is being displayed, the Epic name takes the space where the issue summary was being displayed, making it impossible to view the issue summary. It would be great if it was possible to remove the Epic name when the Issue Detailed view is open.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to remove the Epic name from the Backlog when the issue detailed view is being displayed

fields.description:
The red/yellow/green remaining estimate values for the current sprint are great in plan mode.

Having those values on each column in work mode would be really useful to understand the work remaining in the context of the project's workflow.

This should also support time estimation, not just story points
fields.summary: ENHANCEMENT: Display Remaining estimate values on Work Mode columns

fields.description:
On planning board, issue details view the "Component" is not a link, so we can not easily switch to Components view in JIRA.

It would make our daily work much easier.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the Component field to show links for the values displayed in the Detail View (to be consistent with JIRA)

fields.description:
Whenever we perform a search in the 'Issue Navigator' for issue type Epic, we are presented with the *'Epic Name'* column.

On the other hand, whenever we search for Story, we are presented with the *'Epic Link'* column - which displays the key of the Epic that the Story relates to.

It would be nice to be able to perform a search for issue type *Story* and get both Epic Name and Link fields as results, so that we can get a list of Stories, their related Epic's keys and their names on the same screen.
fields.summary: Get 'Epic Name' field when searching issue type Story in the issue navigator

fields.description:
*Usecase #1*
If you use *Convert to Issue* on a sub-task, the issue is removed from the current sprint and *completely disappears from all reports* (e.g. sprint report, burndown report)

*Usecase #2*
If you change an issue's metadata so that it no longer matches the rapidboard's *filter query*, it *completely disappears from all reports* (e.g. sprint report, burndown report)
fields.summary: Scope changes are inconsistent
Investigate whether any WebDriver tests can be effectively replaced with JS tests

fields.description: Very trivial -- just a small inconsistency with the displayed names of the panels
fields.summary: Tools dropdown should say "Versions Panel" (not "Version Panel) and "Epics Panel" (not "Epic Panel)

* replace global state query in view with setters
* find places dependent of global state and introduce local variable indirection for these states
* wrap modules with closure with depended modules as arguments
* introduce a module framework
fields.summary: Make JS code more modular; less dependant on global objects

fields.description:
It's very elegant to do bulk change in PLAN mode. It's a true time saver.

Why don't we get similar contextual menu upon right clicking but in WORK mode?
fields.summary: As a user, I want to do bulk change on selected issues with Right-clicking inside WORK mode, just like in PLAN mode

fields.description: a horizontal line that points back to the Y axis letting people know how much remaining time was left would be useful for measures.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like a horizontal line on the Burndown chart leading to the Y-axis for accurate measurement of Time Remaining Estimate

fields.description:
Some projects can have similarly named epics that are unrelated to each other.

With a scrum board spanning multiple projects, this can be confusing.  It would be nice if the Epic Name was prefaced with the project code or something.

Main workaround is the actually put the project name in the Epic Name.
fields.summary: Preface Epic Names in Rapid Board with Project name or abbreviation

fields.description: The sprint backlog gets too cluttered with the labels for both version and epic. It would be good to be able to toggle either of the label sets on and off–even if you want to see the two panels.
fields.summary: As a GH scrum user, I can see both the epic and version panels but toggle on/off label sets on the sprint backlog

fields.description: As a user I'd like to have a quick filter for filtering issues by state: not started, in progress, done. It would be great to use the red, yellow, green labels in the top of the sprint: click on one of them for filtering, click again for removing the filter again. The labels should be buttons.
fields.summary: Agile Board - Quick filtering of issues by state (not started, in progress, done)

fields.description: As a greenhopper user in the agile board in plan mode I'd like to be able to filter or sort all issues by issue type. I know there is a search field but it doesn't work that smart as I expected.
fields.summary: Filtering/Sorting of issues by issue type in sprint plan

fields.description:
When blog post is created:
update URL in gh-help-paths.properties for agile.blogs.versions.url=
Uncomment line 434 in WelcomeView.soy
fields.summary: Add blogpost link to What's New text for 6.2

fields.description:
Every time we end a sprint, every person in the team gets several HUNDRED e-mails about every task which left the sprint, and then again when the tasks is assigned to the following sprint. This is not useful.

Please modify the notification options to allow this to be disabled.
fields.summary: Option to prevent notifications when a sprint is changed.
As a product owner, I need to fix estimates which break Burndown and other reports

fields.description:
If Greenhopper is enabled in an instance, but not licensed, it will still add Epic Name as required to epic issue type.

If the Epic issue type has been removed and new issues types have been made, this will cause the Epic Name to be required whatever new issue type has the same ID as the old Epic Issue. (See [GHS-6927]).

In OnDemand Greenhopper comes bundled and enabled by default, but not licensed, making this scenario possible.
fields.summary: Greenhopper requires Epic fields even if unlicensed
